item.title: Testing on the (unfortunately) boundary of the maintained Hypothesis
item.description: In standard testing problems, parameter values in the null hypothesis are interior points of the maintained hypothesis. (D.K.Andrews, 2001) The standard testing problema happens to be as follows being \(\beta_{1}\) a sub-vector of the unknown parameter \(\theta\). \[ \begin{align} H_{0}:&&\beta_{1}=\beta_{1*} && (\text{Null Hypotheses} ) \\ H_{1}:&&\beta_{1}\neq\beta_{1*} && (\text{Alternative Hypotheses} ) \\ K:&&\beta_{1}\in R^{p_{1}} && (\text{Maintained Hypotheses} ) \\ \text{where } && K = H_{0} \cup H_{1} \end{align} \] Additionally, all parameters are identified under the null and the alternative hypotheses.
